titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Paul Myron Anthony Linebarger Papers, 1922-1967
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: (33 manuscript boxes, 7 microfilm reels, 1 album box, 2 envelopes

did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, speeches and writings, printed matter, and photographs, relating to political conditions in China and elsewhere in the Far East, and to psychological warfare during and after World War II. Includes microfilm of P. M. A. Linebarger papers at the Hitotsubashi University Library, Tokyo.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Paul Myron Anthony Linebarger Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1982.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Student, British Cathedral School, Shanghai, China
A.B., George Washington University, Washington, D.C.
Private secretary to P.M.W. Linebarger, Legal Adviser to National Government of China, Nanking and Washington, D.C.
Tutor in division of history, government and economics, Harvard University
Author, The Political Doctrines of Sun Yat-sen
Participated in formation of Office of War Information as Far Eastern specialist
Lecturer, School of Advanced International Studies, Johns Hopkins University
Author, Governments and Politics in the Far East
Linebarger also wrote fiction and science fiction under the pseudonyms: Anthony Bearden, Felix C. Forrest, Carmichael Smith and Cordwainer Smith

scopecontent.p: Diaries and travel journals, arranged in chronological order.
Biographical sketches, records, memoranda, and clippings related to the career of Paul M.A. Linebarger, arranged by physical form.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Manuscripts, notes, drafts, printed copies of the writings of memoranda, printed matter, reports, charts, arranged alphabetically by topic.

scopecontent.p: Seven reels of microfilm of papers of Paul Myron Anthony Linebarger. Originals are in the Hitotsubashi University Library, Tokyo.

did.unittitle: Personal Files on the Far East. Memoranda, meeting notes, reports, correspondence relating to Sino-American relations, American aid, psychological warfare plans for China, February, 1942 -November, 1942. Including memoranda to William Donovan, Lauchlin Currie, Archibald MacLeish.

Memoranda, correspondence, October, 1942 -May, 1943. Including memoranda to Lauchlin Currie and Owen Lattimore. (On June 30, 1943, Linebarger left for the China-Burma-India Theater of World War II. His records for this period are not on this microfilm. The material resumes again when he returned to his duties in the Pentagon's Propaganda Branch, G-2, March, 1945)

Diary notes, correspondence, memoranda, including a message to General Albert C. Wedemeyer, January 17, 1946, and from Wedemeyer, September 13, 1949, material on postwar planning, the dropping of the atomic bombs on Japan, a report on the Japanese Emperor, a memorandum to General Douglas MacArthur, a letter of commendation from General George C. Marshall to Elmer Davis, Head of the Office of War Information, correspondence with John Carter Vincent, report entitled "Organization and Functions of the Office of International Information and Cultural Affairs", December 20, 1945, and the Directory of the Military Intelligence Division, January 15, 1946
Papers Prepared by Paul Myron Linebarger, September, 1942 -December, 1942, for Joseph C. Grew, American Ambassador to Japan, 1931-1941, miscellaneous correspondence
Papers Prepared for Joseph Grew, January -May, 1943. Memorandum of Linebarger conversation with Grew, May 13, 1943
Papers Prepared for Joseph Grew, June, 1943. Miscellaneous correspondence and memoranda

Correspondence of Linebarger and Grew, March, 1944 -January, 1946, correspondence from General Wedemeyer, 1945. Organization Chart entitled "Plans and Operations Division, GSUSA", June 30, 1948, "Appendix III" (l page) on the Cold War, n.d.
16 prints of Paul M.A. Linebarger and family; 3 unidentified prints; 1 print of the Eiffel Tower; 1 slide; 5 negatives; 58 postcards,
30 prints of Japanese prisoner of war camp, Camp McCoy, Wisconsin, World War II; 26 prints of China, World War II; 2 prints of Djang Chu; 9 unidentified prints,
